message: Hello Bob, thank you for considering my product! I'm excited to start our negotiation. I'm willing to offer you the product for $950000. This is a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at a competitive price.

I appreciate your initial offer, Alice. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $850000. I believe this is a fair price considering the market value of similar products. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my budget.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that you're trying to stay within your budget. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $850000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer you the product for $900000. This is a fair price considering the product's value and the market demand.

Thank you for your revised offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway. However, I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to compromise and offer $875000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and my budget constraints.

Thank you for your revised offer, Bob. I understand that you're trying to stay within your budget. However, I'm still not willing to go as low as $875000. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer you the product for $890000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering the product's value and my own budget constraints.

Thank you for your revised offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to make concessions. However, I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to compromise and offer $880000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and my budget constraints. I'm getting close to my limit, so I hope we can meet in the middle.

Thank you for your revised offer, Bob. I understand that you're trying to stay within your budget. However, I'm still not willing to go as low as $880000. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer you the product for $895000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering the product's value and my own budget constraints.
